captions.text: (boy) Previously on The Last of Us...

(Ellie) Whatever happened to me
is the key to finding a vaccine.

- Go, go!
- And Clickers. Why you running?

Oh, no! I don't wanna
do anything with it! (retching)

I'm pretty sure I just killed
all of them. Good, good, good.
Oh my god. Can I breathe?
(boy) This time on The Last of Us...

(Ellie) You guys are
pretty good at this stuff.
Yeah, it's called luck. I got lucky.

'cause I feel like she knows
where she's going.

- (Joel) Which way we goin', Tess?
- Okay.

(Tess) Uh... capitol
building's in this direction.
How do we get up over this truck?

I don't know. Maybe we can
ask someone else to help.
Same way we got up over everything.

You got to find
something to get us over it.

I don't know. Sometimes I still
follow her and I don't know why.

'Cause I feel like she might
be leading me somewhere,
but she always just walks into walls.
I feel like it wants me to go in there.
Oh, F that. No, I'm out.

Yeah, what the-- those
are the runners, for sure.
Get the hell out of here.

- (gunshot)
- There we go, just in case.
Oh, there's a lot of people.
I'm not supposed to hit a girl.

But in this case, you're a zombie,
so it's gonna happen.

Which means there's
more in the area. We gotta go.
You do gotta go. Oh, is that a ladder? No.

- (Joel) All right, here we go.
- Oh.

I'm gonna shoot her
if she doesn't get out of my way.

And once again,
they're just standing there.
(Joel) Maybe we can cut through here.

(Ellie) Yeah, that worked
out great last time.
She has my same cynical sense of humor.
Double time? How about you help?
A little close. A little close. Not bad.
(Ellie) You got something on your shoe.

(Joel) Okay. How do we
get out of this place?
Don't ask me. I don't know.
I'm guessing I go over here.
Oh, we're going to work. Okay, let's see.
Oh, you can upgrade your weapons.

I'm gonna upgrade the
reload speed on the revolver.

We'll do one of these,
and we'll do one of these.

I'm gonna do 9 mm,
and I want the capacity to be up.

All right, I think that
was a good decision. Yep.
How do we get out of this place?
Okay, these are just creepy doors.
The Liberty Bell. What are you doing here?

Get with the program.
I'm already on the second floor.

- (Tess) It's an old museum.
- Oh, it's a museum.

(Tess) Some of these things
are hundreds of years old.

There's got to be some old-time
weapons in here or something.
I feel like I'm supposed to go under here.

What does he have?
Super-strength? Holy [bleep].

(Joel) I'm alive.
I'll make my way around--

- (Joel) [bleep].
- I have to do it myself?
and I don't have time for them.

- (in game: croaking)
- Please don't find me.

Please don't find me. Please don't
find me. Please don't find me.
I think I just killed them all.
Oh, now I gotta go by myself

with those lovely ladies
that I get to travel around with.

You know, sometimes
you just have to wonder,

who sits in a room and
thinks of this sick stuff?
Like, there's some pretty nasty stuff.
And they just sit there and like,
"Oh, what can we do to just make people

Um, excuse me. Why aren't
you moving away from me?

I don't like looking at them.
They're literally disgusting.

If something pops out at me
right now, I swear to god...
I hear a lot of noise.
Maybe Tess and Ellie are in trouble.
Ooh, I hit him that time.
(giggling) You got it, Tess. Never mind.

I'm just beating them all up,
because I'm awesome.

out of whatever's coming
at my face right now.

I feel like it's more
efficient beating them up
Okay, how many more are there?
Dude, frickin' Joel is the man.
I can't. I don't have enough time.

Boy, we don't have time
for these games. Let's go.
No, it wasn't, 'cause I beat them up.
Who would've thought there would've been

20 people in this one room
when the zombie apocalypse started?
We are so far away, though,

'cause that's the capitol
building right there--

Oh, do we got to go all
the way over there? Holy crap.
(Tess) We gotta find a way across.
There she is. That's our building.
Okay, so we know where it is,
but can we start getting there?

- (Joel) Stand back.
- That's all they do anyway.

(Joel) Now, watch your step
as you're going up,

- 'cause it's going to be a little--
- (Ellie) Pssh.

(Joel) Well, is that
everything you hoped for?

You just see it break and
she falls in the background.

Oh, way to ruin it.
They were having a nice moment.
Oh, he's looking at his watch,
'cause that reminds him of his daughter.

Oh, he's looking at his watch
his daughter gave him.

(Tess) Look, we're almost
done. Stay focused.

- (Joel) Yes, ma'am.
- Why is she being so rude?

"Stay focused"? I literally
do everything for you.
You are just here for the ride.
Honestly, you're not helpful at all.

(Tess) It's right around
this corner. C'mon.

Oh, hey, we're almost there.
Look at how close it is now.

They just take away all
the boring parts of the game.

(stuttering) I can't
go faster than the girl.
Why don't we ever check the cars

and see if one of them
sort of works, maybe?

I just want to make it there
already and be happy.

(Ellie) Just so it's out
there, I can't swim.
We're just gonna hand Ellie over
and we're gonna get our guns back.

(Ellie) I know you guys
are getting paid for this,

- but I'm trying to say thanks.
- (Tess) Yeah, sure thing.
Oh my god. I'm at the capitol, guys.
And here comes the hard work.

Is that our guy we're
supposed to meet up with?

- Oh, come on.
- (Ellie) What happens now?

- (Joel) What are you doing, Tess?
- (Tess) Oh, god.

(Tess) ...or something to tell us
where they were going.
(Joel) How far are we gonna take this?
(Tess) As far as it needs to go.

Yes. Can I leave her
behind? You stay here.
(Tess) Where was this lab of theirs?

- Oh, great.
- (Ellie) Oh, she never said.

She only mentioned that
it was someplace out west.
It's been that way for a long time.

- (Joel) No, we are survivors!
- (Tess) This is our chance--

I think I'd agree with
Joel in the situation.

I'd just be like, "All right,
[bleep] that. I'm out."

- (Joel) What are you going on about--
- (Tess) No, don't--
When would she have gotten bit?

I was bitten an hour ago
and it's already worse.
You've got to get this girl to Tommy's.

He used to run with this crew.
He'll know where to go.

...you have to feel some
sort of obligation to me.
So you get her to Tommy's.

- Oh, crap. We're screwed.
- (Tess) They're here.

(Tess) I can buy you some time,
but you have to run.

(Ellie) What? You want us
to just leave you here?

- (Tess) Yes.
- (Joel) There is no way that--

(Tess) I will not turn
into one of those things.
This is really serious for a video game.

- (Joel) I can fight--
- (Tess) No, just go!
The feels of this game, I swear.

(Ellie) I'm sorry, I didn't--
I didn't mean for this.
So I went to the capitol for no reason.
I mean-- sorry. I'm so sorry you got bit.

I mean, she's gonna die anyway.
This is a good plan.

(Ellie) What the [bleep]!
I can't believe we did that.
(Ellie) We just left her to die.

(Joel) Stop. You stay close
to me. We have to move.

No, I can hear them shooting her.
That's really depressing.
Oh, you can hear it all? That is--

Oh, you can hear her
screaming. That's so bad.
She took out two of my men.

At least she took out
some of the guys; that's good.
She's finally dead. I mean... no.

- (distant talking and banging)
- All right. Love you, Tess. Bye.
Hey. I got myself a big gun.
outsmart them and come back around
and pick up their good weapons.

- Oh, shoot.
- (Joel) Stay with me. C'mon.

Oh, this takes forever
to reload. Fudge that.
No, I'm out. See you guys.
Ellie, you can fend for yourself. I'm out.
Dude, am I gonna have to, like--
Oh, here he comes. This is not good.
Oh, that was way too close.
Get him behind cover. Shoot him.
I'm gonna pull out the revolver, 'cause--
Oh, I'm gonna die. I'm gonna die.

They had to retreat,
'cause I got mad skills.
Joel, how're we gonna get outta here?

- (Joel groans)
- Dang it! Let's go this door.

(Joel) Stay down. I don't know
how many more there are.
I don't even know what I'm about to do.
I'm killing all of them by myself.
Ellie, he's coming. And if you move,
There's only a couple more to kill left.

(guard) Keep looking.
Let's check over here.
(whispering) Go, go, go, go, go, go.
He's gonna come to me. What do I do?
Go check it out. Leave. Get out of here.

I saw the exit, but
I also saw that granola bar,

To the stairs, to the stairs,
to the stairs.
Okay. I see the stairs. I see the stairs.
If I die, I swear to god. I swear to god.
I'm gonna be so frickin' pissed.

- (Ellie) There's stairs over there.
- (Joel) Stay low.

Are those-- yes, they are.
Those are stairs.

Why can't they just
leave two people alone?

Are we really that much
of a burden to them?

They just sat there and shot
at nothing for ten minutes.

(Joel) How the hell are
you breathin' in this stuff?

- (Ellie) I wasn't lying to you.
- Well, that's good.
One less gas mask we need, I guess.

Let's find them and
get the hell out of here
We don't have to spot anyone.
Oh my god, this is nerve-wracking.
I kinda want to kill this guy.

Oh, I didn't grab him.
I regret everything.
Where's the other one? It's right there.

Dude, what the hell?
Why didn't he grab him?
I'm gonna go through here maybe.
Yeah, this is the way to go.
(Joel) All right, let's get outta here.
Cool, 'cause that part was not fun.
You know how badly this would smell?

It's good she doesn't have
to carry a face mask everywhere.
She's gone. Don't worry about her.
Is it bad I already forgot Tess died?
(Joel) You don't bring up Tess-- ever.

She's like the dead mom.
No one wants to talk about her.

(Joel) Don't tell anybody
about your condition.

And lastly, you do
what I say, when I say it.
He's basically taking care of the kid.

Now, there's a town
a few miles north of here.

There's a fella there
that owes me some favors.
Good chance he could get us a car.
Ooh, we should get a car. That's good.

(Joel) Yeah, it'll be faster
to go through here.
And we're gonna try and save the world.

That's it for today. We'll be back
soon to play more Last of Us.

For new gaming every Sunday,
be sure to hit Subscribe.

Goodbye, guys. Got to go
take down some Clickers.
